references.reason: This paper introduces the core concept of prediction-powered inference (PPI), which is the foundation for the methodology presented in the current paper.
This paper improves upon the original PPI method, offering a more efficient and practical approach that the current paper builds upon and extends.

references.paper_title: Distribution free, risk controlling prediction sets
references.reason: This paper provides theoretical groundwork for valid confidence interval calculations with potentially biased estimators, which is crucial for the analysis in the current paper.

references.paper_title: Chapter 36 large sample estimation and hypothesis testing
references.reason: This chapter provides foundational statistical results on the asymptotic behavior of estimators, which are essential to the theoretical analysis of the proposed stratified PPI method.

references.paper_title: Asymptotic properties of weighted M-estimators for standard stratified samples
references.reason: This paper provides theoretical results on the asymptotic behavior of stratified M-estimators, directly used in the analysis of the proposed stratified PPI method.
